com.actinarium.rhythm

Class MagicVariablesArgumentsBundle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.actinarium.rhythm.SimpleArgumentsBundle
      • com.actinarium.rhythm.MagicVariablesArgumentsBundle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ArgumentsBundle

    public class MagicVariablesArgumentsBundle
extends SimpleArgumentsBundle
    An implementation of ArgumentsBundle that utilizes “magic variables” mechanism to resolve missing layer arguments: if an argument is not explicitly specified, it tries resolving it from a variable named in a special pattern @{layer_name}_{arg_name} where dashes are replaced with underscores.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.actinarium.rhythm.ArgumentsBundle

    • Constructor Detail

      • MagicVariablesArgumentsBundle

        public MagicVariablesArgumentsBundle(@NonNull
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> arguments,
                                     @NonNull
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> variables,
                                     java.lang.String layerName,
                                     @NonNull
                                     android.util.DisplayMetrics metrics)
        Create a new simple arguments bundle implementation from provided key->value map.
        Parameters:
        arguments - A collection that maps arguments to values. In this implementation both the key and the value are raw strings, parsed into required data types as requested from the map. The values must be already provided as parsable literal values — this implementation cannot resolve variables or calculate expressions.
        For performance reasons, this map will be used as is, therefore it must not be mutated. Furthermore this implementation lacks methods to put new parameters into the bag.
        variables - A @key->value map containing magic variables to fall back to
        layerName - Layer name as registered in the factory, e.g. grid-lines
        metrics - Display metrics associated with this arguments bundle, required so that dimension values (dp, sp

    • Method Detail

      • hasArgument

        public boolean hasArgument(java.lang.String key)
        Test if there's an argument with given key in the bundle, even if the value is null. If the argument is not declared explicitly, will look up if a matching magic variable is present.
        Specified by:
        hasArgument in interface ArgumentsBundle
        Overrides:
        hasArgument in class SimpleArgumentsBundle
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        Returns:
        true if argument is present regardless of value

      • resolveArgument

        protected java.lang.String resolveArgument(java.lang.String key)
        Resolves argument value from the bundle. If the argument is not present in this bundle's arguments map, tries to fall back to a variable with a magic name of @{layer_name}_{arg_name} (concatenated layer and argument names with dashes replaced by underscores).
        Overrides:
        resolveArgument in class SimpleArgumentsBundle
        Parameters:
        key - key of the argument whose value to resolve
        Returns:
        string representation of resolved value
